commitResults.messageTitle: XyDuke now echos user commands, exit when "bye"
stores text entered by user, lists tasks when requested
added task class, can now mark or unmark tasks as done
added support for multiple task types using inheritance
i/o redirection technique to semi-automate testing of Duke
handle errors using exceptions: invalid commands, incomplete commands
added support for deleting tasks, fixed bug where task descriptions cannot contain commands
updated automated testing to test delete and error handling
fixed bug where inputs of the form <command> + <string> where string does not begin with a whitespace is not recognized as invalid
Task class: Added numTasks static variable.
commitResults.messageBody:
Use static variable Task.numTasks to keep track of number of tasks,
instead of checking task's array size.

Good coding practice, follows OOP principles better.

Tasks are saved in duke.txt. Tasks are loaded from hard disk when
Duke boots up.

Duke can now parse date and time String inputs into LocalDateTime
objects.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/tasktypes/Deadline.java
#	src/main/java/tasktypes/Event.java

Task number from user input should not be more than number of tasks
available.

Extracted TaskList class from Duke class. TaskList object handles
all task list related operations.

Extracted Storage class from Duke class. Storage class handles all
loading and saving tasks to data file.

Extracted Ui class from Duke class. Ui class handles all
interactions with user.

Parser class makes sense of user input (command).
Command object represents a type of Command, each having unique
execute behavior.

commitResults.messageTitle: Put all classes into package duke. Further divide into multiple packages.

commitResults.messageBody: Integrate Gradle into IntelliJ. Build and Run Duke using gradle.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of code.
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement test for ToDo and Deadline Tasks, check correctness
of String conversion and Save Format conversion.

commitResults.messageTitle: Privatize fields to obey information hiding. Change Task Class to abstract class.
commitResults.messageBody: Fields in Command classes and TaskTypes classes are set to private.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak code to comply with given coding standard.

commitResults.messageBody: Users can now search for matching tasks using keywords or phrases.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/duke/parser/Parser.java

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/duke/parser/Parser.java
#	src/main/java/duke/storage/Storage.java
#	src/main/java/duke/tasklist/TaskList.java
Include Gradle checkstyle script and CheckStyle-IDEA plugin.

commitResults.messageTitle: FindCommand: Add VarArgs support for initializing FindCommand instance.
commitResults.messageBody: Support searching for multiple keywords.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug for Deadline and Event tasks where invalid date/time input will result in Duke crashing.
Update JavaDocs for methods changed to support GUI implementation.

commitResults.messageBody:
There are several methods across Parser, Storage and TaskList
classes that could user an assert statement.

Adding assert statements improves the method's reliability and
the reliability of XyDuke as a whole.

Let's identify areas in code where assert statements could benefit
by ensuring program correctness at that point and prevent further
build up of incorrect program state.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve on code quality through refactoring.
commitResults.messageBody:
There are several methods that are excessively long and untidy. This
severely affects code readability and should be improved.

Transforming long methods into a number of small methods improves
code quality.

As a step towards further refactoring, let's extract functionalities
into separate short methods in their respective classes. Doing so
shortens lengthy methods and makes code more readable.
Improve on code quality through refactoring.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/duke/parser/Parser.java
#	src/main/java/duke/tasklist/TaskList.java
Add Java Assertions to XyDuke
Print tasks ordered by deadline.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add method to reset task ID counter variable
commitResults.messageBody: Implemented to ensure consistency in test cases for String conversion.

  Add method to reset task ID counter variable
  Fix CheckStyle errors
  Add "orderedlist" command
  Set up Continuous Integration using GitHub Actions
  Improve on code quality through refactoring.
  Add Java Assertions to XyDuke

commitResults.messageTitle: Add changes to GUI and Duke's personality.
commitResults.messageBody:
Custom images and icons for Duke's GUI.
Crop circular images for DialogBox.
Renamed Duke to XyDuke.
Change font color to discern User and XyDuke's messages.
Change font size to make text more visible.
Change ScrollPane background color to make GUI more pleasing.

Add error handler for invalid deadline or event inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Improve error handling for adding deadline or event tasks that are
missing a DateTime input.

GUI logic now detects ExitCommand. Closes GUI window upon saving
current state of tasks.
Add User Guide for XyDuke.
